title: Personal Loans
introduction: Personal loans are unsecured loans provided to individuals for various personal needs without requiring collateral. This module covers key features, eligibility criteria, documentation, and the application process, along with additional details and FAQs from the learning module.

content.value: Personal loans offer flexibility and convenience for customers with diverse financial needs.
Typically ranges from ₹50,000 to ₹20 lakhs based on eligibility and lender policies.
Usually range from 10.5% to 24% per annum, depending on credit profile and income.
Repayment periods range from 12 to 60 months.
Typically between 1% to 3% of the loan amount.
Banks assess various factors to determine a customer's eligibility, including age, income, employment history, and credit score.

items: Stable employment (typically a minimum of 2 years)
Good credit history (CIBIL score above 750 preferred)
Identity Proof: PAN, Aadhaar, Passport, etc.
Address Proof: Utility bills, Rental agreement, etc.
Income Proof: Salary slips, Form 16, IT returns
Employment Details: Employee ID or appointment letter

content.value: The process typically includes application submission, document verification, loan approval, disbursement of funds, and repayment via EMIs.

items: Verification of documents and credit history

content.value: A personal loan is an unsecured loan used for personal needs such as medical emergencies, weddings, education, or home renovation. The borrower repays the loan in monthly EMIs with interest.
Why Do People Take Personal Loans?

items: Loan amounts up to ₹50 lakh (based on eligibility)
Flexible repayment tenure of 1 to 5 years
Interest rates ranging from 10% to 24% per annum
Q: Why do banks charge interest on personal loans? A: To make a profit and manage risk.

source: Merged from personalLoans.json and the Personal Loan section of 01 CASA, Personal loan & Credit card.pdf
